intro: Psychotria uapacifolia, commonly known as the "Bleeding Heart" plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped red flowers that contrast with its dark green foliage. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Psychotria uapacifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
